header.title: AI-Powered Development Tools
header.description: Master modern development workflows with AI code agents, MCP, Skills, and Hooks

aiAgents.title: Understanding AI Code Agents
aiAgents.description: Evolution from AI tools to autonomous agents and comparison of major tools
aiAgents.evolutionTitle: From AI Tools to AI Agents
aiAgents.importantNoteDesc: AI agents don't replace developers—they augment them, allowing focus on higher-level problems. Final responsibility always lies with humans.

mcp.title: MCP (Model Context Protocol)
mcp.description: Standard protocol for AI agents to access external tools and data
mcp.conceptDesc: MCP is a standard protocol that allows AI agents to safely access databases, browsers, external APIs, and more. MCP servers provide specific capabilities that AI agents can invoke.

visualizer.description: AI agents access various external services (databases, browsers, GitHub, etc.) through MCP servers.

tips.tip1: Only enable MCP servers needed for your project
tips.tip2: Set read-only mode for servers accessing sensitive data
tips.tip3: Add team-specific features with custom MCP servers

skillsHooks.title: Skills and Hooks
skillsHooks.skillsInfoDesc: Skills let you define complex, frequently-used tasks and invoke them with slash commands. /commit and /review-pr are typical examples.

skillExamples.name: /commit
skillExamples.desc: Analyze changes and create conventional commit

skillsHooks.hooksInfoDesc: Hooks are scripts that run automatically on specific events (file save, command execution, etc.). Used for auto-formatting, linting, blocking dangerous commands, and more.
skillsHooks.claudeMdInfoDesc: CLAUDE.md informs AI agents about your project's tech stack, coding conventions, and important rules. It lives at the project root.

agentMode.title: Agent Mode in Practice
agentMode.description: Master agent modes in Claude Code and Cursor
agentMode.planModeInfoDesc: For large-scale refactoring or new features with wide impact, Plan mode lets AI create a plan first and execute only after user approval.
agentMode.cursorInfoDesc: Define AI coding style, automatic tasks, and prohibitions in Cursor's .cursor/rules file.

promptEngineering.title: Advanced Prompt Engineering
promptEngineering.contextInfoDesc: Using file paths, pattern references (@), and doc references helps AI generate more accurate results.
promptEngineering.iterativeInfoDesc: For complex tasks, don't request perfection at once. Progress from big picture → detailed implementation → edge cases.

workflows.title: Practical Workflows
workflows.description: Automated workflows for feature development, bug fixes, and code review
workflows.featureDevInfoDesc: Execute the full cycle with AI: requirements analysis → design (Plan) → implementation → testing → review → commit.

tips.tip1: Automate PR creation and review with GitHub MCP
tips.tip3: Integrate with CI/CD for deployment automation

verification.title: Verification and Safe Usage
verification.description: AI code verification, permission management, and team guidelines
verification.autoVerifyInfoDesc: Use PostToolUse hooks to automatically run type checking, linting, and related tests after file saves.
checklist: Is it consistent with existing code patterns?
Are there security vulnerabilities? (input validation, auth)
Are there performance issues? (N+1, memory leaks)

required.title: Required Verification
items: Manual review required for all AI-generated code
Senior developer approval for security-related code
All tests must pass before production deployment

prohibited.title: Prohibited
items: Direct MCP connection to production DB

verification.importantNoteDesc: No matter how powerful AI agents are, final responsibility always lies with developers. Always review AI-generated code before committing.
